medical_history.chief_complaint: Persistent skin lesions on the hands.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had a small abrasion on his left hand, thought to be caused by a dog bite, five weeks before admission. After treatment with antibiotics, lesions on the left hand developed increasing erythema and an enlarging hemorrhagic bulla, followed by a diffuse urticarial and purpuric rash on the torso. New lesions progressed to the right hand and were painful, with ulceration extending to the tendons. The condition worsened despite treatment.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of diabetes mellitus, recurrent hidradenitis suppurativa, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, cholelithiasis, malignant melanoma (excised), macrocytic anemia with low folate levels, multi-nodular goiter, diverticulosis, microhematuria, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, bradycardia with pacemaker, and bilateral leg edema.
medical_history.social_history: Retired, lives with wife, smokes cigarettes, drinks alcohol in moderation.
